medical_history.chief_complaint: Ectopic bone formation following bilateral transposition of temporal muscles due to congenital bilateral facial paralysis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began following surgery in October 1992. Ectopic ossifications were first noticed in November 1996, approximately four years postoperatively, and progressively developed over time, showing bilateral swellings near the zygomatic region without causing any problems.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of congenital bilateral facial paralysis affecting the mother, grandfather, five of the grandfather’s seven brothers, one sister, and three of the great-grandmother’s four sisters.
